properties.description: Create a pipeline named 'GetMetaData_Example' to fetch the list of all the files available inside the ADLS folder.
Create a pipeline name 'Foreach_Example' to copy the Customer & Customer address table data into ADLS using the one copy activity.
Create a pipeline that first checks whether the Customer.csv file is available in the folder location. If it is available it will copy the file data to the Customer Table.
4. Create a pipeline that will create the incremental pipeline using the table instead of HighWaterMark File.

activities.name: Step1_Get_HWM_Date
activities.description: Step1: Get high Water Mark Date from SalesLT.ETL_APLCTN_CNTL table

activities.name: Step2_Get_Max_Last_Updt_TS_Customer_table
activities.description: Step2: Get Maximum Last Updated Timestamp from the customer table

properties.description:
Create a pipeline name 'Foreach_Example2' to copy the below information using just one copy activity.

- All the product table data where productid > 100
- All the customer table data where Customer id>100 and Customer id <1000

sqlReaderQuery.value: @if(equals(item(),'product'), 'select * from saleslt.product where productid > 100','select * from saleslt.customer where customerid > 100 and customerid < 1000' )

properties.description: This pipeline is to read files from folder using Get Meta Data utility
This pipeline is created to understand how does the Get Meta Data Activity works.

activities.name: Step1_GetMetaDataActivity
activities.description: This is get meta data activity to read metadata of a file

sqlReaderQuery.value: Select * from saleslt.customer where ModifiedDate > '@{activity('Step1_GetDateTime').output.firstrow.prop_0}' and ModifiedDate <= '@{activity('Step2_GetLastModifiedDate_CustomerTab').output.firstRow.maxDate}'

properties.description: Create a pipeline to join the two files (Customer, Customer Address) based on customer id and save the result as a JSON file.

Create a pipeline to read the Customer table data from SQL and CustomerAddress data from CSV, join both, and then save the result where customer id> 1000 & Customer id <2000 in ascending order as a Parquet file.
This is the first ever DataFlow I created, to understand the dataflow.
